title: Psychology 101 for Writers & Their Characters
description: Nine pages of questions and answers regarding what precisely is going on in the creation of characters, settings, plots, threads, etc. and what is going on in the author as he works as well as what needs to go into the crafting of characters' psychology on the page. This pamphlet is the brainchild of an author who has been publishing for over 30 years and has written 50 novels, nonfiction, and short stories. The author has also taught creative writing for some 30+ years. Hard-won lessons made easier and more palatable for you whether you are a writer, a reader, or somone who wants to know more about how creativity works.
author: Robert W. Walker
